title: shinypak
text: apps stored branches sap repo. can also specify regex return table branches matching particular chapter topic:

title: shinypak
text: launch app Shiny App-Packages book, can supply name branch launch(): example, ’ll start one branches early chapters Shiny App-Packages (app quite app-package yet): launch() check application already downloaded, download application files folder current working directory, launch app: branch storing app-package, launch() loads package launches application:
code: launch(app = "<branch>") launch(app = "02.3_proj-app") ✔ '02.3_proj-app' not in local working directory [59ms] ✔ downloading '02.3_proj-app' [10.7s]  ✔ got '02.3_proj-app' [163ms]          ✔ Launching app with: shiny::shinyAppDir('02.3_proj-app/app.R')

title: shinypak
text: is_r_package() function useful determining directory contains R package. path contains folder isn’t R package, return FALSE. verbose argument set TRUE, details printed checked:
code: is_r_package(path = system.file("pkg", package = "shinypak")) #> [1] FALSE is_r_package(path = system.file("pkg", package = "shinypak"), verbose = TRUE) #> ℹ Checking DESCRIPTION for package fields #> ✔ Package, Version, License, Description, Title, Author, and Maintainer found! #> ℹ Checking .Rroj for project build fields #> ✖ BuildType, PackageUseDevtools, and PackageInstallArgs not in .Rproj! #> ✖ '' is not configured as an R package #> [1] FALSE

title: shinypak
text: launch() calls get_app() function. call get_app(), specified branch application downloaded current working directory:  can open new app project supplying open = TRUE argument:  app already downloaded, files updated latest commit branch.

what: Clone a Specific Branch of the sap Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
title: Clone a Specific Branch of the sap Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
text: Clones specified branch sap GitHub repository current working directory. cleans cloned directory removing .git files, .DS_Store, .Rbuildignore files, renames R project file, optionally opens new RStudio session.

title: Clone a Specific Branch of the sap Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
Clone a Specific Branch of the sap Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
text: app name branch cloned character string. specified, defaults "main". open logical parameter, set TRUE, function attempt open new R project new RStudio session using rstudioapi::openProject. Defaults FALSE.

title: Clone a Specific Branch of the sap Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
text: Invisible NULL. function called side effects.

title: Clone a Specific Branch of the sap Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
text: directory branch already exists, deleted re-cloned ensure latest version present. cloning, function performs cleanup operations: Deletes .git directory files. Removes .DS_Store files. Deletes .Rbuildignore files present. renames R project file match name cloned branch , specified, opens project RStudio.

title: Clone a Specific Branch of the sap Repository and Optionally Open it — get_app
text: rstudioapi::openProject function requires RStudio installed work R running inside RStudio. working directory temporarily changed function's execution reset end.

title: Check DESCRIPTION File for Package Fields — is_pkg_description
Check DESCRIPTION File for Package Fields — is_pkg_description
text: file character string specifying path DESCRIPTION file. verbose logical parameter; set TRUE, detailed messages displayed check.

title: Check DESCRIPTION File for Package Fields — is_pkg_description
text: logical value; TRUE required fields present, FALSE otherwise.

title: Check DESCRIPTION File for Package Fields — is_pkg_description
code: is_pkg_description(      system.file("pkg", "DESCRIPTION",                  package = "shinypak")) #> [1] TRUE is_pkg_description(      system.file("pkg", "DESCRIPTION",                  package = "shinypak"), verbose = TRUE) #> ℹ Checking DESCRIPTION for package fields #> ✔ Package, Version, License, Description, Title, Author, and Maintainer found! #> [1] TRUE

code: is_r_package(      system.file("pkg", package = "shinypak"),      verbose = TRUE) #> ℹ Checking DESCRIPTION for package fields #> ✔ Package, Version, License, Description, Title, Author, and Maintainer found! #> ℹ Checking .Rroj for project build fields #> ✖ BuildType, PackageUseDevtools, and PackageInstallArgs not in .Rproj! #> ✖ '' is not configured as an R package #> [1] FALSE is_r_package(      system.file("app", package = "shinypak"),      verbose = TRUE) #> ℹ Checking DESCRIPTION for package fields #> ✔ Package, Version, License, Description, Title, Author, and Maintainer found! #> ℹ Checking .Rroj for project build fields #> ✖ BuildType, PackageUseDevtools, and PackageInstallArgs not in .Rproj! #> ✖ '' is not configured as an R package #> [1] FALSE

what: List Branches of the sap Repository — list_apps
title: List Branches of the sap Repository — list_apps
text: function clones 'sap' GitHub repository, extracts list branches along last update time, returns information tibble. repository cloned temporary directory, removed function executes.

title: List Branches of the sap Repository — list_apps
List Branches of the sap Repository — list_apps
text: regex optional character string containing regular expression (regex) filter branch names

title: List Branches of the sap Repository — list_apps
text: tibble three columns: 'source', 'branch_name', 'updated', listing source branch, branch name, last updated date.

title: List Branches of the sap Repository — list_apps
text: function operates several steps: saves current working directory revert back later clones 'sap' repository GitHub temporary directory lists branches cloned repository separates branch names source branch_name cleans deleting temporary directory restoring original working directory Note function currently use regex parameter filter branches. parameter can implemented future versions allow branch filtering based regular expressions.

title: List Branches of the sap Repository — list_apps
